articles.title: Reception for delegates to 2001 Grand Festival for National Reunification
Kim Yong Nam meets delegates to 2001 festival
Withdrawal of U.S. forces from South Korea urged
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam meets delegates to 2001 festival 
    Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met north, south and overseas delegates to the 2001 Grand Festival for National Reunification at the Mansudae Art Theatre yesterday and had a talk with them in a compatriotic atmosphere.
 Present there were secretary Kim Yong Sun of the c.c., the Workers' Party of Korea, and officials concerned.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il greets Jiang Zemin
Full investigation into pollution by oil leakage demanded
Greetings to President of Gabon
articles.content:
Full investigation into pollution by oil leakage demanded 
    Pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Green Federation in a statement issued on August 10 in connection with the pollution caused by oil leakage from the U.S. forces' base in Ryongsan, Seoul, called for forming a civilian-government joint fact-finding group for full investigation into it, according to Seoul-based radio no. 1.
 The statement urged the U.S. forces side to open to the public the background against which the pollution was committed for years and damage done by it, punish the chief culprit and fully investigate the environmental pollution caused by the U.S. forces' base whose return is now under debate.

articles.title: Joint photo exhibition held
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Gabon 
    pyongyang, August 16 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to El Hadj Omar Bongo, President of Gabon, on August 13 on the occasion of its independence day.
 The message extended warm congratulations to the president, government and people of Gabon on the independence day.    
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would further expand and develop, it wished the president and people of Gabon great success in their work for the peace and security of the country.
